website_summaries.verdict: Easy to make adjustments in the field with finger dials. Top-of-the-line performance.
pros: Rugged with waterproof/fog-proof features and excellent focus
Suits all kinds of hunting needs and works well at both sunrise and sunset by boosting available light
cons: Price runs higher than some other scopes

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I first tried the freedom line last year. Looking through them in low light made me chuckle and shake my head that we spend so much money on high dollar equipment that can’t beat something like this. I’ve replaced this spring all of my VX-2’s, FXII’s, and VX3’s with Freedoms and VX3i’s...Its that much of a difference. I would equate the freedom line in low light about on par with the VX3i’s. I also use these freedoms on 444’s so they have taken a pounding. I hunt almost year around, I do not maintain my equipment, and I’m hard on the rifles.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia B. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Leopold is quality.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much what I expected, nice clear optic. Mounted it on my Marlin 336C in 30-30. Probably too much scope for a brush gun, but my 69 year old eyes like it. If I could change anything, the clicks on the elevation and windage turrets are a bit mushy. Nice crisp clicks would be better. That being said, adjustments were linear and predictable.
customer_reviews.author: Karl H

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Went to Cabelas and compared Nikon and Vortex scopes to the Leupold , the Leupold hands down winner
customer_reviews.author: Roy E Reno

customer_reviews.title: Leupold's quality is slipping & becoming embarrassing for the company.
customer_reviews.text: As a long time user of leupold scopes, I was disappointed with this one. The quality of the glass was reasonable for the price line of this scope, but the turret system is one of the worst I have seen. Difficult to sight in as the scope would not respond well to turret adjustments. I would never purchase another low end leupold scope. Stay with the VX3I as a minimum.
customer_reviews.author: Gunsmoke

customer_reviews.title: One of my very best scopes. Everything I had hoped it would be ...
customer_reviews.text: One of my very best scopes. Everything I had hoped it would be and more. Just wish Leupold would include lens covers with they're scopes.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy E D Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Great value, clear glass
customer_reviews.text: Before I even mounted it, I was looking through it ten minutes after legal hunting hours would have ended if it were deer season and came to the conclusion that this glass is more than clear enough to comfortably make lowlight shots with confidence. Adjustment dials are mushy but this has been mounted and sighted in 3" high at 100 yds where it will stay so I cannot comment on how well it tracks but the mushy turrets don't bother me. Magnification dial is smooth and the scope overall seems well worth the $169 plus tax that I paid but time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Ksalmi72

customer_reviews.title: Leupold quality at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: This is a comparitivly inexpensive scope but like all the other Leupold products I own, it is excellent. The glass is crystal clear, no edge distortions or color aberrations. It seems to "gather" light&is often easier to see things than with my unaided eye. I mounted this scope to a high quality .22 rifle. With this scope, that rifle is a joy to shoot. I use CCI shells exclusively. The rifle&scope will shoot a quarter dollar size group at 150 yards all day long. I think you will be happy with this scope

customer_reviews.title: Will never use anything but this scope ever again best scope on the market
customer_reviews.text: After bore sighting this puppy. Went out to the range. Shot 3 times at 50 yards. Then another 3 at 100 yards. Made my few adjustments and was putting quarter size groups right where I wanted at a 100 yards with a 30-30 336cw Marlin. On top that was 17° out that morning and I could not get the lenses to fog up to where they were useable and I tried lol... extremely crisp view. Also extremely well on dark cloudy days and low lighting. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a great scope that gets the job done every time for a reasonable price. Especially with the warranty that comes with it

product_meta.title: Leupold VX-Freedom 3-9X40mm Riflescope
feature_bullets: Leupold Model #174180 - VX Freedom 3-9x40mm with Duplex reticle and Matte finish
Made with 6061-T6 aircraft quality aluminum and punisher tested to a lifetime of performance even under harshest recoil.
Twilight Light Management System - Adds up to 10 extra minutes of shooting light and reduces glare for crisp image quality.
Precision 1/4 MOA finger click adjustments for wind age and elevation offer absolute repeatability and dependability over a lifetime of extreme use
Scratch Resistant Lenses - Lens surfaces are scratch resistant to military standard extreme abrasion specification
3: 1 Zoom Ratio - Ideal for virtually any situation
Designed, machined, and assembled in the USA
